data.title: Horicon Marsh, Natural Area in Mayville, WI
data.meta_description: Horicon Marsh is the largest freshwater cattail marsh in the US and is recognized as a Wetland of International Importance. Located in southeast Wisconsin, it is home to the Horicon Marsh Education and Visitor Center, which offers a Wildlife Education Program. Visitors can enjoy recreational activities such as bird watching, wildflower viewing, paddling, and hiking. The venue also features The Explorium, showcasing the history of the marsh. The Friends of Horicon Marsh organization supports the preservation of the trails and facilities through donations and volunteer work. The marsh spans over 33,000 acres and is a crucial resting place for migrating ducks and geese. It offers various outdoor facilities and educational programs, making it a popular destination for nature lovers.
